revision.text:
{{Infobox military person |name=Richard C. Berthurem |birth_date= {{Birth date and age|1943|1|24}} |death_date= |image= |caption= |nickname= |birth_place=[[Green Bay, Wisconsin]], [[United States|U.S.]] |death_place= |placeofburial= |allegiance= [[United States|United States of America]] |branch= [[United States Air Force]] |serviceyears=1966â€“1998 |rank= [[Lieutenant General (United States)|Lieutenant General]] |unit= |commands= |battles= |awards= |relations= |laterwork= }} '''Richard C. Berthurem''' (born January 24, 1943) is a retired lieutenant general in the [[United States Air Force]].<ref name="defense">{{cite web|url=http://www.defense.gov/Releases/Release.aspx?ReleaseID=766|title=Defense.gov News Release: GENERAL OFFICER ANNOUNCEMENT|publisher=defense.gov|accessdate=2015-05-24}}</ref> He was the commander of Allied Air Forces Southern Europe, Naples, Italy, and commander, 16th Air Force, United States Air Forces in Europe, Aviano Air Base, Italy. He was the air principal subordinate commander and the joint and combined forces air component commander for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization's (NATO) Southern Region. He was responsible for the planning and employment of NATO's air forces in the Mediterranean area of operations from [[Gibraltar]] to [[Eastern Turkey]], and was the air commander for air operations in Bosnia-Herzegovina. He is also a former [[List of Commandants of the United States Air Force Academy|Commandant of Cadets]] at the USAF Academy.
Berthurem entered the Air Force in 1966 after graduating from the U.S. Air Force Academy, Colorado Springs, Colo. He commanded the 461st Fighter Squadron, Luke Air Force Base, Ariz.; 49th Fighter Wing, Holloman Air Force Base, N.M.; 831st Air Division, George Air Force Base, California; 4404th Composite Wing, Dhahran Air Base, Saudi Arabia; and the Air Warfare Center, [[Nellis Air Force Base]], Nevada. He is a command pilot, having flown more than 4,300 hours in F-4, F-104, F-15 and F-16 aircraft, with 385 combat missions in Southeast Asia.
His awards include the Distinguished Service Medal, Legion of Merit, Distinguished Flying Cross with two oak leaf clusters, Meritorious Service Medal with two oak leaf clusters, Air Medal with 21 oak leaf clusters, Aerial Achievement Medal, Air Force Commendation Medal, Vietnam Service Medal with eight service stars, and the Republic of Vietnam Gallantry Cross with Palm.
==References== {{Reflist}} {{USGovernment|sourceURL=http://www.af.mil/AboutUs/Biographies/Display/tabid/225/Article/107730/lieutenant-general-richard-c-bethurem.aspx}}
